- `management.*` (matches all commands under the **Management** category).

dateError:
I could not resolve `{{parameter}}` to a date, there are some of the valid formats:

$t(arguments:dateFormats)
dateFormats:
- `2016-11-24` (YYYY-MM-DD)
- `2016-11-24T23:56` (YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm)
- `2016-11-24T23:56:12` (YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ss)
- `2016-11-24T23:56:12.000` (YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ss.sss)

> **Tip**: The last 3 formats accept `Z` at the end to mark the time as UTC. Alternatively, you can input your timezone's offset by adding `+HH:MM`, e.g. `+01:00`.
